messages.subject: " e-bay "missing sword  resolved
messages.msgSnippet: gang, happy to report the sword is found and located. It is with the prankster  and he promised not to dip the sword in acid to enhance the hamon nor wack  the
messages.messageBody:
gang,
happy to report the sword is found and located. It is with the
prankster and he promised not to dip the sword in acid to enhance
the hamon nor wack the " bushies " ( ops, sorry about that ).
The prank was meant as a " lesson " to me for " thinking " that
there's a possibility a hard working cleaning person could
liberated it from my hotel room ( a resonable possibility as I can't
recall exactly when/where the sword was missed , if I can, then it
won't go missing, yes ? ). The reason it went missing was I left it
in the shinsa room. Absent-mindedness, it comes with advancing age.
So, My appology to all the lists for causing all the fuss.

One thing I learned from this " prank "......................
The show organisers are quick with members' concern, when I
reported the e-bay listing very early in the morning ( through e-
mail ), I got an immediate response. They contacted the hotel
security immediately and initiated an investigation which I have to
later explain that it could be a possible prank. Not funny.

Lastly ,thank you all for the concerns, suggestions. I am glad the
sword is not with some wackos who may actually use it to wack the
bushies ( ops, sorry about that, again ).

Milt
